content.user_title: Skill Creator - Build Custom AI Agent Skills
content.value_statement: Create structured, reusable skills that extend Claude's capabilities with specialized workflows, domain knowledge, and tool integrations through guided templates and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skills from templates with proper directory structure
Package skills into distributable .skill files with automatic validation
Validate skill structure, frontmatter, and naming conventions
Guide skill design with proven patterns for workflows and output formatting
Organize bundled resources (scripts, references, assets) effectively
Implement progressive disclosure to manage context window efficiently
limitations: Requires Python 3 environment for running utility scripts
Validation is basic and may not catch all design issues
Does not test or execute skill logic automatically
Does not provide runtime debugging capabilities
Requires manual testing of generated scripts

use_cases.title: Package Tool Integrations

use_cases.title: Standardize Workflows
use_cases.description: Encode multi-step processes like code review, content creation, or data analysis into repeatable skills

use_cases.title: Bundle Resources Efficiently
use_cases.description: Organize scripts, documentation, and assets to minimize context usage while maximizing capability
use_cases.target_user: Skill creators optimizing for context window efficiency

prompt_templates.prompt: I have a skill for [purpose] but it struggles with [specific issue]. Can you help me improve the SKILL.md and add better [scripts/references/assets]?

output_examples.input: Create a skill for analyzing SQL query performance
output_examples.output: Skill directory with: (1) SKILL.md with frontmatter and workflow instructions, (2) scripts/analyze_query.py for execution plan analysis, (3) references/optimization_patterns.md with indexing strategies, (4) Packaged sql-analyzer.skill file
Validation report showing passed checks, then brand-guidelines.skill file containing SKILL.md, assets/logo.png, assets/template.pptx, and references/typography.md

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines by splitting content into reference files
Write comprehensive descriptions in frontmatter - it's the primary triggering mechanism
Test scripts by actually running them before packaging
Use progressive disclosure: metadata ‚Üí SKILL.md ‚Üí bundled resources
Default to high freedom (text instructions) unless tasks require precision
Avoid duplication between SKILL.md and reference files
Include 'when to use' information in description, not in body
Delete unused example files generated by init_skill.py
Validate skills before packaging using package_skill.py
Provide concrete examples during planning phase
anti_patterns: Creating README.md, CHANGELOG.md, or other auxiliary documentation files
Writing verbose explanations when Claude already has the knowledge
Duplicating information across SKILL.md and reference files
Including 'When to Use' sections in SKILL.md body instead of frontmatter description
Deeply nesting references (keep one level deep from SKILL.md)
Packaging skills without running validation first
Using low freedom (strict scripts) when high freedom (text guidance) suffices
Exceeding 500 lines in SKILL.md without splitting content
Adding extra frontmatter fields beyond name, description, license, allowed-tools, metadata

faq.question: When should I use scripts vs. text instructions?
faq.answer: Use scripts when code is repeatedly rewritten or deterministic reliability is needed. Use text instructions when multiple approaches are valid or context-dependent decisions are required.

faq.question: How do I know if my skill description is good enough?
faq.answer: The description should explain both what the skill does AND specific triggers/contexts for when to use it. Include file types, task types, and concrete scenarios that should activate the skill.

faq.question: What goes in references/ vs. assets/?
faq.answer: References are documentation loaded into context (API docs, schemas, guides). Assets are files used in output without loading (templates, images, boilerplate code).

faq.question: How do I handle skills with multiple frameworks or variants?
faq.answer: Keep core workflow in SKILL.md and organize variant-specific details into separate reference files (e.g., references/aws.md, references/gcp.md). Claude loads only the relevant variant.

faq.question: What's the maximum recommended size for SKILL.md?
faq.answer: Keep it under 500 lines. Beyond that, split content into reference files. The context window is a public good‚Äîonly include what Claude truly needs.

faq.question: Do I need to include all three resource directories?
faq.answer: No. Delete any directories (scripts/, references/, assets/) that aren't needed for your skill. Most skills won't need all three.
